modules.comments:
The Play API provides a way to define declarative layout for creating flexible,
responsive user interfaces in PureScript.

It is inspired by Clay UI layouting system for C++ by Nic Baker. It inherits its simple yet powerful design.

The API supports:
- Flexbox-like layout with direction control (horizontal/vertical)
- Size constraints (fixed, fit-to-content, grow-to-fill, ...)
- Padding and gaps between elements
- Automatic size calculation and positioning

declarations.comments:
A layout tree containing elements of type `a` with layout definitions.
This is the primary type for building layouts before they are computed.

Each element contains:
- User data of type `a`
- Layout definition (sizing, padding, direction, etc.)
- Zero or more child elements

The only required properties for an element to be visible are the way its width / height calculated.

Example:
```purescript
myLayout
  = P.i "content"
  ~* P.widthGrow
  ~* P.height 100.0
  ~* P.padding (P.all 5.0)
  ~* P.with [ P.i "child1", P.i "child2" ]
  :: Play String
```

See more examples in the README and `Test/Demo/Examples` in the source.
declarations.title: Play

declarations.comments:
A computed layout tree with final positioning and sizes.
This is the result of running layout computation on a `Play` definition using `Play.layout` function.

Each element contains:
- User data of type `a`
- Layout definition (preserved for potential rollback)
- Computed rectangular bounds (position and size)
declarations.title: Layout

declarations.comments:
Set the layout direction for arranging child elements.

- `TopToBottom`: Stack children vertically
- `LeftToRight`: Arrange children horizontally (default)
- `BackToFront`: Stack children in layers from back to front

Example:
```purescript
verticalLayout = P.i "container" ~* P.direction P.TopToBottom
```
declarations.title: direction

declarations.comments:
Set padding (inner spacing) on all four sides of an element.
Padding creates space between the element's border and its children.

Example:
```purescript
paddedContainer = P.i "content" ~* P.padding (P.all 10.0)
```
declarations.title: padding

declarations.comments:
Set the spacing between child elements.
This creates gaps between adjacent children in the layout direction.

Example:
```purescript
spacedContainer = P.p "menu" buttons ~* P.childGap 5.0
spacedContainer2 = P.i "menu" ~* P.childGap 5.0 ~* P.with buttons
```
declarations.title: childGap

declarations.comments:
Set the width sizing constraint for an element.
See `Sizing` type for available options (None, Fixed, Fit, Grow, FitGrow).
declarations.title: w

declarations.comments:
Set the height sizing constraint for an element.
See `Sizing` type for available options (None, Fixed, Fit, Grow, FitGrow).
declarations.title: h

declarations.comments:
Add additional children to an existing element.
The new children are appended to the existing children list.

Example:
```purescript
container = P.i "base"
  ~* P.with [child1, child2]
container2 = P.p "base" [child1, child2]
  ~* P.with [child3, child4]  -- Now has 4 children total
```
declarations.title: with

declarations.comments:
Set percentage value between 0.0 and 1.0 representing a fraction of available space.
If the value is outside this range, it will be clamped.
declarations.title: pct

declarations.comments:
Set padding for the top side only.
Other padding values remain unchanged.
declarations.title: paddingTop

declarations.comments:
Set padding for the left side only.
Other padding values remain unchanged.
declarations.title: paddingLeft

declarations.comments:
Set padding for the bottom side only.
Other padding values remain unchanged.
declarations.title: paddingBottom

declarations.comments:
Set padding for the right side only.
Other padding values remain unchanged.
declarations.title: paddingRight

declarations.comments: Set uniform padding on all four sides of an element. An alias for `padding $ all n`.
declarations.title: paddingAll

declarations.comments:
Default layout definition with sensible defaults.

- Direction: `LeftToRight`
- Padding: All sides set to 0
- Child gap: 0
- Sizing: Both width and height set to `None`

This is the starting point for all layout definitions and can be
modified using the various property functions.
declarations.title: default

declarations.comments:
Create padding with the same value on all four sides.
This is a convenience function for uniform padding.
declarations.title: all

declarations.comments:
Create padding for top and bottom sides only (vertical padding).
Left and right padding are set to 0.
declarations.title: tb

declarations.comments:
Create padding for left and right sides only (horizontal padding).
Top and bottom padding are set to 0.
declarations.title: lr

declarations.comments:
Create a layout element that has children (parent).

Parameters:
- `a`: The user data/content for this element
- `Array (Play a)`: Array of child elements

The created element uses the default layout definition, which can be
modified using property functions and the `~*` operator.

Example:
```purescript
container = P.p "header"
  [ P.i "logo"
  , P.i "navigation"
  ]
```
declarations.title: p

declarations.comments:
Create a leaf layout element with no children (item).

This is the primary constructor for creating layout hierarchies and
a convenience function equivalent to `P.p a []`, the children could
be added later using `~* P.with [ child1, child2, ... ]` .

Example:
```purescript
element = P.i "Hello World"
```
declarations.title: i

declarations.comments:
Extract the underlying tree structure from a Play layout.
This is useful for low-level tree operations.
declarations.title: toTree

declarations.comments:
Wrap a tree structure as a Play layout.
This is the inverse of `toTree` and is useful when constructing Play layouts
from external tree structures.

Takes the compiled elements definitions and wraps them in a Play definition (internal representation is the very same `Tree`).
declarations.title: fromTree

declarations.comments:
Compute the final layout from a Play tree specification.
This performs a three-phase layout computation:

1. **Fit Sizing**: Calculate minimum required sizes based on content and constraints
2. **Grow Sizing**: Distribute remaining space to elements with grow constraints
3. **Positioning**: Calculate final positions for all elements

The result is a `Layout` containing all the elements with their computed bounds (positions and rectangles).

Example:
```purescript
myPlay = Play.i "root" ~* Play.with [ Play.i "child1", Play.i "child2" ] :: Play String
computedLayout = Play.layout myPlay :: Layout String
```
declarations.title: layout

declarations.comments:
Extract the tree structure from a Layout, removing layout definitions.
The result contains only the values and computed rectangular bounds.
This is useful for rendering with keeping hierarchy or hit-testing operations.
declarations.title: layoutToTree

declarations.comments:
Extract the tree structure from a Layout, keeping layout definitions.
The result contains only the values and computed rectangular bounds.
This is useful for rendering with keeping hierarchy or hit-testing operations.
declarations.title: layoutToTree_

declarations.comments:
Flatten a Layout into an array of all elements with their computed bounds.
This provides a simple list of all elements for rendering or processing.
The tree hierarchy is flattened but positioning information is preserved,
so it is completely safe to iterate the resulting array and place the elements
in the corresponding bounds. The parents are followed by their children, so z-index
is also preserved.
declarations.title: flattenLayout

declarations.comments:
Convert a computed Layout back to a Play specification.
This removes the computed positioning information but preserves
the layout definitions, allowing for re-computation with modifications.

Example:
```purescript
myPlay = P.i "root" ~* P.with [ P.i "child1", P.i "child2" ] :: Play String
computedLayout = P.layout myPlay :: P.Layout String
originalPlay = P.rollback computedLayout :: Play String
modifiedPlay = originalPlay ~* P.padding (P.all 5.0) :: Play String
newLayout = P.layout modifiedPlay :: P.Layout String
```
declarations.title: rollback

declarations.comments:
Get the total size of the root element in a computed Layout.
This represents the minimum bounding box containing all elements.
declarations.title: layoutSize

declarations.comments: Set width to fit its nested content.
declarations.title: widthFit

declarations.comments: Set height to be a parcentage of the parent container's height. (0.0 to 1.0)
declarations.title: widthPercent

declarations.comments: Set width to grow and fill available horizontal space.
declarations.title: widthGrow

declarations.comments: Set width to fit its nested content but grow if extra space is available.
declarations.title: widthFitGrow

declarations.comments: Set width to fit its nested content, but not less than the specified minimum.
declarations.title: widthFitMin

declarations.comments: Set width to fit its nested content, but not less than the specified minimum or more than the specified maximum.
declarations.title: widthFitMinMax

declarations.comments: Set width to to grow and fill available horizontal space, but not less than the specified minimum.
declarations.title: widthGrowMin

declarations.comments: Set width to a fixed pixel value.
declarations.title: width

declarations.comments: Set width by specifying arbitrary sizing constraint.
declarations.title: width_

declarations.comments: Set height to fit its nested content.
declarations.title: heightFit

declarations.comments: Set height to be a parcentage of the parent container's height. (0.0 to 1.0)
declarations.title: heightPercent

declarations.comments: Set height to grow and fill available vertical space.
declarations.title: heightGrow

declarations.comments: Set height to fit its nested content but grow if extra space is available.
declarations.title: heightFitGrow

declarations.comments: Set height to fit its nested content, but not less than the specified minimum.
declarations.title: heightFitMin

declarations.comments: Set height to fit its nested content, but not less than the specified minimum or more than the specified maximum.
declarations.title: heightFitMinMax

declarations.comments: Set height to to grow and fill available vertical space, but not less than the specified minimum.
declarations.title: heightGrowMin

declarations.comments: Set height to a fixed pixel value.
declarations.title: height

declarations.comments: Set height by specifying arbitrary sizing constraint.
declarations.title: height_

declarations.comments: Set layout direction to arrange children vertically (top to bottom).
declarations.title: topToBottom

declarations.comments:
Set layout direction to arrange children horizontally (left to right).
This is the default direction.
declarations.title: leftToRight

declarations.comments: Set layout direction to arrange children in layers from back to front.
declarations.title: backToFront

declarations.comments: Set horizontal alignment within a container. Use with `PT.HAlign.Horz` for clarity.
declarations.title: alignH

declarations.comments: Set vertical alignment within a container. Use with `PT.VAlign.Vert` for clarity.
declarations.title: alignV

declarations.comments: Set alignment to left within a container on the horizontal axis.
declarations.title: alignLeft

declarations.comments: Set alignment to center within a container on the horizontal axis.
declarations.title: alignCenter

declarations.comments: Set alignment to right within a container on the horizontal axis.
declarations.title: alignRight

declarations.comments: Set alignment to top within a container on the vertical axis.
declarations.title: alignTop

declarations.comments: Set alignment to middle within a container on the vertical axis.
declarations.title: alignMiddle

declarations.comments: Set alignment to bottom within a container on the vertical axis.
declarations.title: alignBottom

declarations.comments:
Property application operator for chaining layout modifications.
This is an alias for flipped function application just to distinguish layout-related calls from other ones.
So it could be replaces with `(#)` operator at any place.

See the example of usage at `Play a` type above.
function
declarations.title: playProp

declarations.comments: Unwrap percentage to number between 0.0 and 1.0
declarations.title: pctToNumber

declarations.comments: Serialize a Play layout to JSON string
declarations.title: toJSON

declarations.comments: Serialize a Play layout to JSON string
declarations.title: toPrettyJSON

declarations.comments: Deserialize a Play layout from JSON string
declarations.title: fromJSON

modules.name: Play

declarations.comments:
An element with its final computed rectangular bounds.
The final result of layout computation, so holds `Def` data no more.
declarations.title: WithRect

declarations.comments:
An element with layout definition and computed size.
Intermediate state during layout computation.
declarations.title: WithDefSize

declarations.comments:
An element with both layout definition and computed rectangular bounds.
Contains complete layout information for potential rollback operations.
declarations.title: WithDefRect

declarations.comments:
An element with its layout definition.
Used during the initial layout specification phase.
declarations.title: WithDef

declarations.comments:
Defines how an element should size itself along a particular axis.

- `None`: No specific sizing constraint
- `Fixed Number`: Fixed size in pixels
- `Fit`: Size to fit the content (minimum required space)
- `Grow`: Expand to fill available space
- `FitGrow`: If fitting the content requires more space than growing, then fit anyway, else grow to fill the available space
declarations.title: Sizing

declarations.comments:
Dimensions of a rectangular area the item occupies.
All values are in pixels.
declarations.title: Size

declarations.comments:
A rectangular area defined by position and size.
Represents the final computed layout bounds of an element.
declarations.title: Rect

declarations.comments: A 2D position of the element's top-left corner.
declarations.title: Pos

declarations.comments: A percentage value between 0.0 and 1.0 representing a fraction of available space.
declarations.title: Percents

declarations.comments:
Defines padding (inner spacing) for all four sides of an item.
Means the space between the border of the item and its children on the corresponding sides.
All values are in pixels.
declarations.title: Padding

declarations.comments: An alias for `Pos`, used to represent relative offsets or displacements.
declarations.title: Offset

declarations.comments:
Defines the layout direction for arranging child elements.

- `TopToBottom`: Children are arranged vertically from top to bottom
- `LeftToRight`: Children are arranged horizontally from left to right
- `BackToFront`: Children are arranged in layers from back to front (z-axis)
declarations.title: Direction

declarations.comments:
The compiled definition from user-specified with API layout properties.
Not intented to be constructed manually.
declarations.title: Def

declarations.comments: Alignment options within a container.
declarations.title: Align

declarations.comments:
A path to a specific item in the layout tree.
Represented as an array of child indices, where each number indicates
which child to follow at each level of the tree.

Example: `[0, 2, 1]` means "first child, then its third child, then its second child"
declarations.title: ItemPath

declarations.comments:
Get the item value at a specific path in the tree.
Returns `Nothing` if the path doesn't exist.
This extracts just the cell value without layout information.
declarations.title: itemAt

declarations.comments:
Get a sub-layout starting from a specific path.
Returns `Nothing` if the path doesn't exist.
The returned `Play`` contains only the subtree rooted at the specified path.
declarations.title: playAt

declarations.comments:
Get the layout definition at a specific path in the tree.
Returns `Nothing` if the path doesn't exist.
This extracts the layout properties (sizing, padding, etc.) for the item.
declarations.title: defAt

declarations.comments:
Update the item value at a specific path using a transformation function.
Returns the original layout unchanged if the path doesn't exist.
Only modifies the cell value, leaving layout definitions intact.
declarations.title: updateAt

declarations.comments:
Update the layout definition at a specific path using a transformation function.
Returns the original layout unchanged if the path doesn't exist.
Only modifies layout properties (sizing, padding, etc.), leaving cell value intact.
declarations.title: updateDefAt

declarations.comments:
Add a new child layout at a specific path.
The new child is appended to the end of the existing children list.
Returns the original layout unchanged if the parent path doesn't exist.
declarations.title: addChildAt

declarations.comments:
Remove a child at a specific index from the element at the given path.
Returns the original layout unchanged if the parent path doesn't exist
or if the child index is out of bounds.

Parameters:
- `path`: Path to the parent element
- `childIndex`: Index of the child to remove (0-based)
declarations.title: removeChildAt

declarations.comments:
Apply a transformation function to the underlying tree structure.
This is a low-level function that allows direct manipulation of the tree
while maintaining the Play wrapper. Use with caution.
declarations.title: overTree

declarations.comments:
Get the subtree at a specific path in the layout.
Returns `Nothing` if the path doesn't exist.
declarations.title: treeAt

declarations.comments:
Find the first sub-layout in the layout tree that is bound to the provided value.
Returns `Nothing` if no such item exists.
The returned value includes both the path to the item and its layout.
Root is at path `[]`.
declarations.title: find

declarations.comments:
Find the first sub-layout in the layout tree in the layout tree that satisfies the given predicate.
Returns `Nothing` if no such item exists.
The returned value includes both the path to the item and the item itself.
Root is at path `[]`.
declarations.title: findBy

declarations.comments:
Find the first sub-layout in the layout tree that is bound to the provided value.
Returns `Nothing` if no such item exists.
The returned value includes both the path to the item and its layout.
Root is at path `[]`.
declarations.title: findInLayout

declarations.comments:
Find the first sub-layout in the layout tree in the layout tree that satisfies the given predicate.
Returns `Nothing` if no such item exists.
The returned value includes both the path to the item and the item itself.
Root is at path `[]`.
declarations.title: findByInLayout

declarations.comments:
Defines the layout direction for arranging child elements.

- `TopToBottom`: Children are arranged vertically from top to bottom
- `LeftToRight`: Children are arranged horizontally from left to right
- `BackToFront`: Children are arranged in layers from back to front (z-axis)
declarations.title: Direction

declarations.comments: An alias for `Pos`, used to represent relative offsets or displacements.
declarations.title: Offset

declarations.comments:
Defines padding (inner spacing) for all four sides of an item.
Means the space between the border of the item and its children on the corresponding sides.
All values are in pixels.
declarations.title: Padding

declarations.comments: A 2D position of the element's top-left corner.
declarations.title: Pos

declarations.comments:
A rectangular area defined by position and size.
Represents the final computed layout bounds of an element.
declarations.title: Rect

declarations.comments:
Dimensions of a rectangular area the item occupies.
All values are in pixels.
declarations.title: Size

declarations.comments:
Defines how an element should size itself along a particular axis.

- `None`: No specific sizing constraint
- `Fixed Number`: Fixed size in pixels
- `Fit`: Size to fit the content (minimum required space)
- `Grow`: Expand to fill available space
- `FitGrow`: If fitting the content requires more space than growing, then fit anyway, else grow to fill the available space
declarations.title: Sizing

declarations.comments: A percentage value between 0.0 and 1.0 representing a fraction of available space.
declarations.title: Percents

declarations.comments: Alignment options within a container.
declarations.title: Align

declarations.comments:
The compiled definition from user-specified with API layout properties.
Not intented to be constructed manually.
declarations.title: Def

declarations.comments:
An element with its layout definition.
Used during the initial layout specification phase.
declarations.title: WithDef

declarations.comments:
An element with layout definition and computed size.
Intermediate state during layout computation.
declarations.title: WithDefSize

declarations.comments:
An element with its final computed rectangular bounds.
The final result of layout computation, so holds `Def` data no more.
declarations.title: WithRect

declarations.comments:
An element with both layout definition and computed rectangular bounds.
Contains complete layout information for potential rollback operations.
declarations.title: WithDefRect
